perturbation.original_text: Subcontractor shall be permitted to subcontract any part of the Work without the prior written notification and consent of EDGE.
perturbation.changed_text: Subcontractor shall be permitted to subcontract any part of the Work only with the prior written notification and consent of EDGE.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding subcontracting. Originally, Subcontractor could subcontract without EDGE's consent. The modified text now requires EDGE's prior written notification and consent. This contradicts Section 30(A), which states, 'All provisions on Subcontractor's forms shall be deemed deleted. Additional or different terms inserted in this Agreement by Subcontractor, or deletions thereto, whether by alterations, addenda, or otherwise, shall be of no force and effect, unless expressly consented to by EDGE in writing.' This highlights the conflict because the original agreement allowed subcontracting freely, but the changed text and Section 30(A) makes the validity and process of subcontracting unclear.
perturbation.contradicted_text: This Agreement shall incorporate the typed or written provisions of EDGE' Purchase Orders issued pursuant to this Agreement and shall constitute the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement and shall not be modified or rescinded except by a writing signed by Subcontractor and EDGE. All references in these terms and conditions to this Agreement or to Work, services, material, equipment, products, software, or information furnished under, in performance of, pursuant to, or in contemplation of this Agreement shall also apply to any Purchase Orders or Amendments issued pursuant to this Agreement. All provisions on Subcontractor's forms shall be deemed deleted. Additional or different terms inserted in this Agreement by Subcontractor, or deletions thereto, whether by alterations, addenda, or otherwise, shall be of no force and effect, unless expressly consented to by EDGE in writing. The provisions of this Agreement supersede all contemporaneous oral agreements and all prior oral and written quotations, communications, agreements, and understandings of the parties with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement.

perturbation.original_text: EDGE's obligation to pay Subcontractor under this Agreement shall not be predicated upon the Customer approving or paying EDGE for the Work.
perturbation.changed_text: EDGE's obligation to pay Subcontractor under this Agreement shall be predicated upon the Customer approving or paying EDGE for the Work.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement clearly states that EDGE's payment to the Subcontractor is independent of Customer's payment to EDGE. The modified text reverses this, making EDGE's payment contingent on Customer's approval and payment. This introduces a Pay-When-Paid clause, which directly contradicts the previous statement and creates uncertainty about when the Subcontractor will get paid. It also directly contradicts the meaning of the original statment, since the 'not' was omitted from the original statment.
perturbation.contradicted_text: This Agreement shall not be construed as a "Pay When Paid" contract. EDGE's obligation to pay Subcontractor under this Agreement shall be predicated upon the Customer approving or paying EDGE for the Work.

perturbation.original_text: After the Initial Term, this Agreement shall continue on a month to month basis until terminated by either party upon thirty (30) days prior written notice to the other setting forth the effective date of such termination.
perturbation.changed_text: After the Initial Term, this Agreement shall continue on a month to month basis and will be considered perpetual, unless terminated by both parties upon mutual written agreement, overriding any individual termination clauses.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause allows either party to terminate the agreement with 30 days' notice after the initial term. The modified clause states that the agreement is considered perpetual unless both parties mutually agree to terminate, effectively overriding the original termination clause. This creates a direct contradiction, as the agreement can now only be terminated by mutual consent rather than unilateral action, making the requirements for termination inconsistent and creating uncertainty about the conditions under which the agreement can be dissolved. This statement directly contradicts the previous statement, thus causing a change that can be argued in court.
perturbation.contradicted_text: This Agreement shall remain in effect for the duration of the Initial Term, unless earlier terminated pursuant to the provision entitled "Termination of Agreement". After the Initial Term, this Agreement shall continue on a month to month basis and will be considered perpetual, unless terminated by both parties upon mutual written agreement, overriding any individual termination clauses. The termination of any Purchase Order shall not affect the obligations of either party to the other party pursuant to any other Purchase Order or to this Agreement. The termination of this Agreement shall terminate the obligations of either party to the other party pursuant to any Purchase Order and those obligations pursuant to this Agreement, except as to obligations that are identified herein or in a terminated Purchase Order as surviving termination.
